column5: I don't have many pics as my camera died but I will add what I have and when I get the pics from my fishing partners I will add a couple My buddy has a great pic of a moose.Another great trip with Air-Dale out of Wawa.This year AirDale is using Watson's Skyways out of Wawa for their flying. An extremely efficient company and a pleasure to fly with,We were scheduled for a 9am flight we arrived at the airbase at 8, I said to the dock lad we are a little early. He replied back your truck in here and we will get your gear weighed. We were weighed, loaded on plane and in the air at 9:20On our return flight we were to be picked up at 10 am the Otter touched down at 10:02I must add we had perfect weather for our flight days, Sunny and light windsWatson's Otterhttp://i43.photobucket.com/albums/e3...0/IMG_1835.jpgThe fishing was amazing we caught more small fish this year, as many 14 - 17 inchers as you could possibly want, but also got into some big ones.My 28 1/2 incher was the biggesthttp://i43.photobucket.com/albums/e3...0/IMG_1840.jpgMy buddy Pat got a 27" which I do not have a picture of Also a bunch from 22-25 incheshttp://i43.photobucket.com/albums/e3...0/IMG_1843.jpghttp://i43.photobucket.com/albums/e3...0/IMG_1844.jpghttp://i43.photobucket.com/albums/e3...0/IMG_1849.jpghttp://i43.photobucket.com/albums/e3...0/IMG_1852.jpgA couple for Shore Lunchhttp://i43.photobucket.com/albums/e3...0/IMG_1854.jpgA double headerhttp://i43.photobucket.com/albums/e3...0/IMG_1851.jpgAlso a big thank you to Martin and Jenn of OutPostCamps.com It was a pleasure to vacation with you once again ThanksRick
Rick, glad you had a great trip and the weather held no surprises.We booked with Hearst Air when we left that Saturday.

Very cool Rick! Sounds like a great trip. Since I was fishing the same week, I'm curious how and where you guys found the walleye? If you haven't been, I think you guys would like Martin's new camp on Little Miss. for next year.

Thanks Pete It was a good trip for sure!!! Chris we caught Walleye Casting,Trolling and Jigging. Jigging is my favorite, 16 FOW Jigging in the evening likely produced the best However one tactic that was lethal on the smaller Walleye was on days with blue bird skies and glass smooth water when the points and shoals that produced so well in the evening were slow We moved deeper into 32FOw and vertical jigged with a worm, It was like ice fishing for Perch there were loads of fish and you could barely get the jig to the bottom without having a bite.
Nice Report. Heading to Apisabigo Saturday. Any areas of the lake more productive? Did you fish the back lakes?
Yes!! For sure some areas were much better than others!! We did fish, Malmo Lake, the portage lake to the south, You have a PM
Beauty walleyes. Thanks for sharing with us.
